actor_awards.notes: Known as 'The Perfect Fool' for his legendary vaudeville and radio persona. He reinvented himself as a dramatic actor in the 1950s, earning an Academy Award nomination for 'The Diary of Anne Frank'. He was named a Disney Legend in 2013.

filmography.title: Mary Poppins
filmography.role_description: A jovial man who floats in the air when he laughs, hosting a tea party on the ceiling.
filmography.plot: A magical nanny employs music and adventure to help two neglected children become closer to their father.

filmography.title: Alice in Wonderland
filmography.role_description: The voice of the eccentric, tea-loving Hatter who celebrates unbirthdays.
filmography.plot: Alice falls down a rabbit hole into a fantasy world populated by peculiar anthropomorphic creatures.

filmography.title: The Diary of Anne Frank
filmography.role_description: A fussy Jewish dentist who hides in the attic with the Frank family, earning Wynn an Oscar nomination.
filmography.plot: Two Jewish families hide from the Nazis in a cramped Amsterdam attic during World War II.

filmography.title: The Great Man
filmography.role_description: A small-town radio station owner who gives an honest and touching eulogy for a deceased celebrity.
filmography.plot: A reporter investigates the life of a beloved radio host after his death, discovering he was actually a despicable person.

filmography.title: The Gnome-Mobile
filmography.role_description: An eccentric timber tycoon who takes his grandchildren on a road trip to find gnomes in the redwood forest.
filmography.plot: A millionaire and his grandchildren discover a pair of gnomes in a forest and try to help them find the rest of their tribe.

filmography.title: Babes in Toyland
filmography.role_description: The quirky creator of toys who employs Tom Piper and Mary Contrary in his workshop.
filmography.plot: Mary Contrary is set to marry Tom Piper, but the evil Barnaby hires two goons to drown Tom and steal Mary's sheep.

filmography.title: The Absent-Minded Professor
filmography.role_description: The town's fire chief who gets involved in the chaos caused by the professor's flying car.
filmography.plot: A college professor invents an anti-gravity substance which a corrupt businessman wants for himself.

filmography.title: Son of Flubber
filmography.role_description: A county agricultural agent who deals with the fallout of the professor's weather experiments.
filmography.plot: The absent-minded professor invents 'flubber gas' which helps the college football team win the big game.

filmography.title: Cinderfella
filmography.role_description: The magical godfather who helps the clumsy Fella attend the ball.
filmography.plot: When his father dies, a young man is left at the mercy of his snobbish stepmother and her two sons.

filmography.title: That Darn Cat!
filmography.role_description: The befuddled jeweler who is held hostage by bank robbers.
filmography.plot: A woman uses her Siamese cat to help the FBI solve a kidnapping case.

filmography.title: The Greatest Story Ever Told
filmography.role_description: A blind man who is healed by Jesus.
filmography.plot: An all-star cast epic retelling of the life of Jesus Christ, from the Nativity to the Resurrection.

filmography.title: Marjorie Morningstar
filmography.role_description: The kindly uncle of the protagonist who works at a summer resort.
filmography.plot: A Jewish girl in New York City in the 1930s dreams of becoming a star but faces pressure to settle down.

filmography.title: Dear Brigitte
filmography.role_description: An eccentric narrator who lives on a houseboat.
filmography.plot: An eccentric professor's son, a math prodigy, develops a crush on Brigitte Bardot and sends her fan letters.

filmography.title: The Patsy
filmography.role_description: One of the team of Hollywood sycophants who try to mold a bellboy into a star.
filmography.plot: When a famous comedian dies, his management team tries to groom a bumbling bellboy to take his place.

filmography.title: Those Calloways
filmography.role_description: A storytelling storekeeper who supports the Calloway family's dream.
filmography.plot: A fur trapper and his family try to create a sanctuary for migrating geese in Vermont.

filmography.title: Requiem for a Heavyweight
filmography.role_description: The loyal trainer of a washed-up boxer in this acclaimed Playhouse 90 production. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A heavyweight boxer faces the end of his career and the corruption of his manager.
filmography.awards: Primetime Emmy: Nomination – Best Supporting Performance by an Actor

filmography.title: Miracle on 34th Street
filmography.role_description: A man who claims to be Santa Claus in this television adaptation of the classic film. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A lawyer defends an old man who claims to be Santa Claus against attempts to have him committed.

filmography.title: The Daydreamer
filmography.role_description: The voice of the Emperor in 'The Emperor's New Clothes' segment.
filmography.plot: A young Hans Christian Andersen learns life lessons from the characters in the stories he will one day write.

filmography.title: The Chief
filmography.role_description: A timid man who accidentally becomes a hero and runs for alderman.
filmography.plot: A weak-willed son of a fire chief unwittingly becomes a hero during a fire and is thrust into politics.

filmography.title: Follow the Leader
filmography.role_description: A waiter who accidentally becomes the leader of a gang.
filmography.plot: A bumbling waiter gets involved with gangsters and is mistaken for a criminal mastermind.

filmography.title: Rubber Heels
filmography.role_description: A graduate of a correspondence school detective course. Wynn's film debut.
filmography.plot: A would-be detective tries to solve a case involving a stolen necklace.

filmography.title: Stage Door Canteen
filmography.role_description: Appears as himself, entertaining troops at the famous canteen.
filmography.plot: Various stars of stage and screen make cameo appearances to entertain American troops during World War II.
